TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKCanvas extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: Encapsulates all of the state about drawing into a device (bitmap).

remarks.para: Encapsulates all of the state about drawing into a device (bitmap).

This includes a reference to the device itself, and a stack of matrix/clip values. For any given draw call (e.g. drawRect), the geometry of the object being drawn is transformed by the concatenation of all the matrices in the stack. The transformed geometry is clipped by the intersection of all of the clips in the stack.

While the canvas holds the state of the drawing device, the state (style) of the object being drawn is held by the Paint, which is provided as a parameter to each of the draw() methods. The Paint holds attributes such as color, typeface, the text size, the stroke width, the shader (for example, gradients, patterns), etc.
The SKCanvas is returned when accessing the property of a surface.
Transformations
The supports a number of 2D transformations. Unlike other 2D graphic systems like CoreGraphics or Cairo, SKCanvas extends the transformations to include perspectives.
You can use the , , , , to perform some of the most common 2D transformations.
For more control you can use the to set an arbitrary transformation using the and the to concatenate an transformation to the current matrix in use.
The can be used to reset the state of the matrix
Drawing
The drawing operations can take a parameter to affect their drawing. You use objects to cache the style and color information to draw geometries, texts and bitmaps.
Clipping Path
State

It is possible to save the current transformations by calling the method which preserves the current transformation matrix, you can then alter the matrix and restore the previous state by using the or methods.

Additionally, it is possible to push a new state with which will make an offscreen copy of a region, and once the drawing is completed, calling the method which copies the offscreen bitmap into this canvas.
The example below shows a typical use:

The paint to use when drawing the picture, or .
Docs.summary: Draws a picture on the canvas.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to calling , followed by with the specified , and then .
If paint is non-null, the picture is drawn into a temporary buffer, and then the paint's alpha, color filter, image filter, blend mode are applied to that buffer as it is drawn to the canvas.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DrawPoints (SkiaSharp.SKPointMode mode, SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points, SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint);
.method public hidebysig instance void DrawPoints(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPointMode mode, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points, class SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint) cil managed

Docs.param: Determines how the points array will be interpreted: as points, as coordinates to draw lines, or as coordinates of a polygon.
The array of points to draw.
The paint to use when drawing the points.
Docs.summary: Draws an array of points, lines or a polygon in the canvas, one at a time.

remarks.para: For , each point is drawn centered at its coordinate, and its size is specified by the paint's stroke-width. It draws as a square, unless the paint's is , in which the points are drawn as circles.
For , each pair of points is drawn as a line segment, respecting the paint's settings for cap, join and width.
For , the entire array is drawn as a series of connected line segments.

Note that, while similar, the line and polygon modes draw slightly differently than the equivalent path built with a series of move to, line to calls, in that the path will draw all of its contours at once, with no interactions if contours intersect each other (think ).

The data that specifies the URL.
Docs.summary: Annotates the canvas by associating the specified URL with the specified rectangle (in local coordinates, just like ).

remarks.para: The caller is responsible for managing its ownership of the data.
If the backend of this canvas does not support annotations, this call is safely ignored.

The blend mode to use to combine the colors with the texture, before being drawn using the paint. Used if both texture coordinates and colors are present.
The shader/texture.

Docs.remarks: If both textures and vertex-colors are , it strokes hairlines with the paint's color. This behavior is a useful debugging mode to visualize the mesh.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Flush ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Flush() cil managed

Docs.summary: Triggers the immediate execution of all pending draw operations.
Docs.remarks: For the GPU backend this will resolve all rendering to the GPU surface backing the surface that owns this canvas.

Docs.param: The resulting clip bounds.

Docs.returns: Returns true if the clip bounds are non-empty, otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: This can be useful in that it tells you that drawing outside of these bounds will be clipped out.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool QuickReject (SkiaSharp.SKPath path);
.method public hidebysig instance bool QuickReject(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to compare with the current clip.
Docs.summary: Checks to see if the specified path, after being transformed by the current matrix, would lie completely outside of the current clip.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the path (transformed by the canvas' matrix) does not intersect with the canvas’ clip.
Docs.remarks: Call this to check if an area you intend to draw into is clipped out (and therefore you can skip making the draw calls).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool QuickReject (SkiaSharp.SKRect rect);
.method public hidebysig instance bool QuickReject(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect rect) cil managed

Docs.param: The rectangle to compare with the current clip.
Docs.summary: Checks to see if the specified rectangle, after being transformed by the current matrix, would lie completely outside of the current clip.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the rectangle (transformed by the canvas' matrix) does not intersect with the canvas’ clip.
Docs.remarks: Call this to check if an area you intend to draw into is clipped out (and therefore you can skip making the draw calls).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResetMatrix ();
.method public hidebysig instance void ResetMatrix() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the current matrix to identity.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Restore ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Restore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Restore the canvas state.
Docs.remarks: This call balances a previous call to , and is used to remove all modifications to the matrix, clip and draw filter state since the last save call. It is an error to restore more times than was previously saved.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RestoreToCount (int count);
.method public hidebysig instance void RestoreToCount(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The number of levels to restore from, or -1 to restore all the way back to the initial value.
Docs.summary: Efficiently restores the state to a specific level.
Docs.remarks: Efficient way to pop any calls to that happened after the save count reached . It is an error for to be greater than . To pop all the way back to the initial matrix/clip context set count to -1.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Save ();
.method public hidebysig instance int32 Save() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the canvas state.
Docs.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
Docs.remarks: This call saves the current matrix, clip, and draw filter, and pushes a copy onto a private stack. Subsequent calls to translate, scale, rotate, skew, concat or clipping path or drawing filter all operate on this copy. When the balancing call to is made, the previous matrix, clipping, and drawing filters are restored.

MemberSignature.Value: public int SaveCount { get; }
.property instance int32 SaveCount

Docs.summary: Gets the number of matrix/clip states on the canvas' private stack.
Docs.remarks: This will equal the number of calls minus calls + 1. The save count on a new canvas is 1.

MemberSignature.Value: public int SaveLayer (SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 SaveLayer(class SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint) cil managed

Docs.param: This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
Docs.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
Docs.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
Docs.remarks: This behaves the same as but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).

MemberSignature.Value: public int SaveLayer (SkiaSharp.SKRect limit, SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 SaveLayer(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect limit, class SkiaSharp.SKPaint paint) cil managed

Docs.param: This clipping rectangle hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap.
This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
Docs.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
Docs.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.

remarks.para: This behaves the same as but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).

The limit rectangle, is used as a hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap, and thus drawing may be clipped to it, though that clipping is not guaranteed to happen. If exact clipping is desired, use .
